website_summaries.verdict: These top-notch welder's sleeves will protect you against sudden flame exposure, molten splash and sparks.
pros: Made from flame-retardant, 100-percent cotton Proban FR7A, ensuring the sleeves are constructed to last
Each green fire stop cotton sleeve is both comfortable and versatile
Sold as a pair to deliver outstanding value
cons: The sleeves' elastic bands and seams tend to wear down over time

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap and do the job. If have long arms and these are the only sleeves that actually provide enough coverage with a T-shirt on. They work but the quality of construction leaves a lot to be desired. The green fabric holds up fine, the elastic bands and the stitching that holds them on will fall apart far before there are any major problems with the main fabric. I wish someone made this long size with better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: a lotta protection for a little money.
customer_reviews.text: I cast my own bullets, so I`m handling molten lead at 650-700 degrees. One little hot speck with lite you up. These cover my entire arms and give a comfortable protection. They are not heavy, have lots of air room inside,and are long enough to cover my arms. Yesterday I smelted down and cleaned up 160 lbs of wheelweights, and these little units guarded my arms the whole time. If I needed to, I would surely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: A "value" choice, not a long term heavy use choice
customer_reviews.text: I have used these heavily for slightly over a year. The only reason I am giving 4 stars is the price - they work quite well for what you're paying. After a year the elastic is mostly failing and mine have hundreds (if not thousands) of little holes from spatter - and more than a few bigger holes from grinding sparks and larger burn through areas. These would suit the light use hobbyist down to a T. I don't think I'd view them as a professional grade product and soon I'll invest in something better.
customer_reviews.author: windsofkarma

customer_reviews.title: Spend money for a jacket instead
customer_reviews.text: Sleeves provide good flexibility but burn way too easily, buy a jacket
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Needs better stitching in the cuffs.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these sleeves. I ripped the cuffs of the first pair taking them on and off. I continued using them until they were burned up and no good. I figured I'd be careful with the second pair but the cuffs are starting to rip after about a month's use. Good product but could use better stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for metal grinding too
customer_reviews.text: I actually don't use these for welding. I use them for metal grinding. Keeps me a lot cooler than my full welding jacket and keeps the sparks off my arm.
customer_reviews.author: C. Doneza

customer_reviews.title: falling apart from day one
customer_reviews.text: Both sleeves were unraveling at the seams on arrival. They work well but I am going to have to sew them and that just simply is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Rccolaman

customer_reviews.title: good item, flame retardant...
customer_reviews.text: I think this item has a flame retardant chemical. The flame retardant seems to give out the same smell from my welding jacket, made of cotton aand other sythetic fibers, similar to this product. And so, this product has the same smell, and I think it is flame resistant. However, the flame reatrdant might wear off after many laundry cycles.
customer_reviews.author: hyperionx

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and they are beyond my expectations. I have purchased 3 more. Get them while they last.
customer_reviews.author: NICK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our welding kit; very efficient to have these.
customer_reviews.author: SBS

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your arm hair from burning
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what they claim they will do, they protect your arms. No more burnt hair smell at the bbq, no more burns either. The elastic is okay though I don't use these daily so I don't know how it'd hold up. And what a color! I feel like I'm in Miami Vice when I wear them. All in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jakeymon

customer_reviews.title: fit
customer_reviews.text: Iiked everything about the product.. everything price fit speedy shipping
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Geibel

customer_reviews.title: One of the few welding sleeves that fits large arms ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the few welding sleeves that fits large arms and doesn't ride down through out the day. Last about 6 to 8 weeks ,averaging five 20 inch welds a day, if you take of the upper elastic band when pulling it up your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron day

customer_reviews.title: They work as they should and are nice when it's too hot to wear a jacket
customer_reviews.text: They work as they should and are nice when it's too hot to wear a jacket. I had to repair one of the stitches when they were new so only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mel and Kev

customer_reviews.title: Best welding sleeves I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeves, are very long and fit nicely over my big canons.

customer_reviews.title: my arms love it
customer_reviews.text: great sleeves for the price. well made and heavy duty. better than putting on that hot jacket of hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Tmothy D Holmes Jr

customer_reviews.title: A must if you are a welder
customer_reviews.text: I have large arms. these fit great. they do the job. great when I am grinding and I am wearing short sleeve shirts

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These do they job. I have only had spatter burn through once or twice. I am a large guy with very large arms and these fit me. D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a better fit for me
customer_reviews.text: The sleeves aren't as hot as wearing the jacket. This is a better fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not made for automotive restoration work.
customer_reviews.text: These work well against grinding sparks and are good for clean metal welding NOT old rusted cars or dirty metal that kicks off alot of slag when you try to weld. These are for light duty as opposed to leather for heavy duty. Im 6'1 the upper sleeve is very tight on an 18 inch bicep but does not fall down the length is purfect covers the arm from wrist to just below the armpit .

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great choice. I am not a welder, but turn wood and these are excellent for my use. They protect my arms from being coated in chips of wood and minimize the amount of cleanup time.I recommend them to all woodturners.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Storey

customer_reviews.title: Saves the Arms
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fireplace Insert and I'm always burning my arms just above the gloves when putting wood in. The US Forge 99411 23-inch Welders Sleeve keeps that from happening, it is also good for handling wood, and prunning among mother things.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkler Fitter's Dream
customer_reviews.text: I am a fire sprinkler fitter, when i have to drill in a parking garage for hangers, the concrete dust gets on my arms and dries them out, these are perfect for keeping that dust off of your arms especially at the wrist area. Your skin will absorb the dust when you sweat and anyone who does this knows how much it hurts when you get that concrete rash. Perfect product for this application
customer_reviews.author: Donald

product_meta.title: US Forge 99411 23-Inch Welders Sleeve
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This 23-inch, 9-ounce Welder's Sleeve has green fire stop cotton sleeves with 2-1/2-inch elastic at both ends. It is made from flame retardant, 100% cotton Proban FR7A and offers protection from sudden flame exposure, light molten splash, and sparks, but is still washable.
